channel.title: Cmd|Java, Small problem
channel.description:
I really need help on this, well when I got into Programming I started off with newbie bases and fed off em and learnt from moparscape (mostly got spoonfed because the tuts those days sucked). but erm My first ever source isn't "SILAB" and I miss it :( I stopped this source because it had this problem that really pissed me off...
When I run my server after it's on for like 3 hours I check Task manager then processes and it's full of Java.exe and Cmd.exe it made my computer REALLY slow and my server UBER lag so I would have to end all of those processes or restart my computer. PLEASE help me with this I really want to use my old source, I'm really bored of silab servers.
Inside my run.bat [code] @echo off color 0b title Barragezaros set java="C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe" java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause[/code] that looks fine..TO ME and I'm not too good at programming so it would be awesome if you could help me with this.

item.title: Cmd|Java, Small problem
item.dc:creator: @killboy600 killboy600
item.description:
@killboy600 wrote:

Thanks, It still hasn’t solved this annoying problem.
Here’s a pic it might help
l]

I only left my server running for just 30 mins and this is how much I got, Usually would get A LOT MORE.
I don’t know if this is a promlem or not but I have a restarter that only needs run.bat to be ran it restarts alone every 30 mins.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 09, 2008, 02:31:49 pm[/size][hr]Guess this isn’t solvable… :s

Read full topic

item.title: Cmd|Java, Small problem
item.dc:creator: @Zach_93 Zach 93
item.description:
@Zach_93 wrote:

You don’t need:

set java="C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe"

Read full topic

I really need help on this, well when I got into Programming I started off with newbie bases and fed off em and learnt from moparscape (mostly got spoonfed because the tuts those days sucked).
but erm My first ever source isn’t “SILAB” and I miss it
